Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as bcccb4af1393a25bf02bf2753e233e7016e5138d

Dear all,
Could you also help to review this commit? Thank you.

Best regards,
Tim

Dear Benjamin,

Could you please help us to review and merge this commit?
This commit is dependent on below commit.

Due to we need to support generate full flash image for npcm8xx. Thank you.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/56005

Sincerely,
Tim

Can we use the recipe from Yocto instead of making a new one?

https://git.yoctoproject.org/meta-arm/tree/meta-arm/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a

We create this arm-trusted-firmware recipe that refer to ARM-software GitHub.
Due to we cannot find any trusted-firmware recipes from OpenBMC GitHub.
Thus, we need your help to merge this recipe for Nuvoton npmc8xx.
Similar to OP-TEE, we can get the recipe I linked in OpenBMC by pulling in the meta-arm layer from Yocto. That's the right path forward for supporting ATF

Thanks your great support to pull in the meta-arm layer into OpenBMC.
We will modify this recipe through right path for supporting ATF when layer be pulled in.

Hi Benjamin,

We had provided new recipe for binary release.
Please help us to review and merge it for npcm8xx platform. Thanks a lot.

Best regards,
Tim

Why does it need to be a binary? Can you make a bbappend of the recipe from meta-arm that points to your fork instead?

Also the upstream ATF project is very responsive, so please start getting these changes submitted there

:+1:.  Please avoid binary blobs for all this stuff.  The one major point of open source is that we don't have to rely on trusting your systems that built it.  If I can't see the source for the blob and build it myself, I don't think I can trust it for "security".

Can I suggest that Nuvoton actually submits a minimal open-source TIP firmware that doesn't include their proprietary stuff? Something like what Hao and I did to get this booting in QEMU:

https://github.com/google/vbootrom/tree/master/npcm8xx
https://github.com/peterdelevoryas/vbootrom/tree/main/npcm8xx

In particular (and this is something I was going to do myself) we need something that probes for the U-Boot image. Hao and I just hard-coded offsets that we grepped from `bitbake -e` to test that out. https://github.com/peterdelevoryas/vbootrom/blob/d7e78079e7f5c257f397291eb31fcf9cf48b17c6/npcm8xx/image.c#L169-L172

Oops, commented on the wrong thing. I was referring more to the TIP firmware, where a binary blob was also submitted. The source code for the TIP firmware doesn't seem to be available, that's why I was suggesting a minimal no-op version. That recipe already got merged though, I think I was too late.

The code for this does seem to be open-source though, so it seems like this one can be open-sourced with minimal development effort.

Thanks all you guys suggestion. Sorry, we need more time to integrate our code to meta-arm layer trusted-firmware-a recipe. We are happy to share code for sure.

Can we use one patch into bbappend for nuvoton platform modification?
Due to we need to add drivers/nuvoton and plat/nuvoton these two folders
to support nuvoton platform in TFA.

Hi Patrick,
Did you means that I can use bbappend to replace SRC_URI to our GitHub https://github.com/Nuvoton-Israel/arm-trusted-firmware instead of git://git.trustedfirmware.org/TF-A/trusted-firmware-a, right?
If so, we don't need a patch for nuvoton platform modification. Thanks.

You've named the recipe here "2.6.0.x", which implies to me that it is based on the upstream trusted-firmware-a-2.6.0 release as a base.  In meta-arm there is trusted-firmware-a-2.7.0.bb, not 2.6.0.  The way I see it you have two choices:

1. Rebase your Nuvoton repository onto 2.7.0 and use a bbappend.
2. Create a 2.6.0 recipe here (using `require trusted-firmware-a.inc` so the majority of the recipe is shared upstream).

I would tend to prefer #2 because it is keeps working if the upstream recipe changes and we (the project) don't need to do any work to figure out how to fix up a "2.7.0.bbappend" when the "2.7.0.bb" is removed in meta-arm.

Hi Benjamin and Patrick,

We have created new recipe 2.6.0 that using official ATF GitHub release tag v2.6, instead our GitHub. For support npcm8xx in ATF, we add nuvoton platform related modification as patches, but according patch policy, we got build failed in repotest.
Could we add those patches into repotest table to fix this kind of failure?

Best regards,
Tim

This still looks like duplicating what meta-arm is providing.

1. meta-nuvoton layer.conf should have dependency on meta-arm.

2. Nuvoton platform patches are added by meta-nuvoton/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/arm-trusted-firmware_%.bbappend (instead of .bb file).

3. conf/machine/include/npcm8xx.inc (or a separate inc file) initialize necessary variables like TFA_PLATFORM, TFA_UBOOT, TFA_BUILD_TARGET ,etc. see this for example - https://git.yoctoproject.org/meta-arm/tree/meta-arm-bsp/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a-juno.inc.

With this any machine that includes npcm8xx.inc would inherit all the settings.

According previous discussion that tend to prefer #2.
Thus, we didn't rebase ours to 2.7.0 with a bbappend.
We create a 2.6.0 recipe here. Do you prefer #1 method?

1. Rebase your Nuvoton repository onto 2.7.0 and use a bbappend.
2. Create a 2.6.0 recipe here.

I hope rebasing to 2.7.0 won't be major rework (quick glancing through plat code). It will also help you to prepare for posting to tf-a gerrit in 2.8.0 merge window.

But more importantly it will help to use the build infra meta-arm is providing.
e.g. TFA_UBOOT variable sets up dependencies -
https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/master/meta-arm/meta-arm/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a.inc#L129

I think you misunderstood what #2 meant.


There are already recipes in meta-arm:

./meta-arm/meta-arm/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a.inc
./meta-arm/meta-arm/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a_2.7.0.bb

You should make a minimal

meta-nuvoton/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bb

It should be _identical_ to the original version from meta-arm (when they supported 2.6.0).

https://github.com/jonmason/meta-arm/blob/7aa3997684276fe467e51aa6c065a5437d5deba5/meta-arm/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a_2.6.bb

Inside this file it will do an include on trusted-firmware-a.inc.  This should be continue to be done.

Next, add a file trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bbappend .  This file should have 3 lines:

SRC_URI:remove = ... (remove the meta-arm URI)
SRC_URI:append = ... (add nuvoton)
SRCREV = ... (nuvoton SRCREV for 2.6.0.x which includes your necessary patches)

Patrick, thanks so much your detail and useful suggestion for us.

Now, I'm very clear what's #2 meaning. Only one question need your help it.
We have a arm-trusted-firmware.inc for nuvoton npcm8xx that include some build options for 2.6.0, but seems is not compatible with original include file. 

In trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bb that will require trusted-firmware-a.inc.
My question is how to integrate our include file to this original include file?
Is it using trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bbappend to append it?
Or is there any way to make it more compatible for this modification?
You can probably put those into a separate `trusted-firmware-a_%.bbappend` under meta-nuvoton.

I had create trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bb and trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bbappend in meta-nuvoton/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a folder. However, I meet one build error "Could not find this trusted-firmware-a.inc" as below:

ERROR: ParseError at /home/tim/npcm-master/openbmc/meta-nuvoton/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bb:1: Could not include required file trusted-firmware-a.inc
ERROR: Parsing halted due to errors, see error messages above

In my bblayers.conf, I had add meta-arm related layer as below, but still cannot fix this kind of build error.

BBLAYERS ?= " \
  /home/tim/npcm-master/openbmc/meta-arm/meta-arm-toolchain \
  /home/tim/npcm-master/openbmc/meta-arm/meta-arm \

From bitbake user manual seems I need create trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bb in meta-arm/meta-arm/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a folder. Due to there are trusted-firmware-a.inc and trusted-firmware-a_2.7.0.bb.

https://docs.yoctoproject.org/3.1/bitbake-user-manual/bitbake-user-manual.html#require-inclusion

As an example, suppose you have two versions of a recipe (e.g. foo_1.2.2.bb and foo_2.0.0.bb) where each version contains some identical functionality that could be shared. You could create an include file named foo.inc that contains the common definitions needed to build "foo". You need to be sure foo.inc is located in the same directory as your two recipe files as well. Once these conditions are set up, you can share the functionality using a require directive from within each recipe:

     require foo.inc

Whether we really need to create trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bb in meta-arm layer?
Or I lose some modification for require directive?
Could you please kindly provide your suggestion for this problem? Thank you.

When I'm creating trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bb and trusted-firmware-a_%.bbappend in meta-arm/meta-arm/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a, then build trusted-firmware-a v2.6 got build pass and bl31 image be generated successfully. BTW, SRC_URI be modified to Nuvoton SRCREV for 2.6.0.x which includes all our patches. Thus, we didn't need all ATF patches in meta-nuvoton.

This doesn't seem right.

trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bbappend is adding nuvoton specific stuff, it must be in meta-nuvoton and not meta-arm.

Also, making changes directly to meta-arm doesn't seem to be the right approach as it's just a mirror of upstream meta-arm.


> I had create trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bb and trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bbappend in
> meta-nuvoton/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a folder. However, I meet one build 
> error "Could not find this trusted-firmware-a.inc" as below:

"require trusted-firmware-a.inc" won't work, bitbake searches only in BBPATH and local folder. Try specifying long path (relative to meta-arm) - "require recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a.inc"

Indeed, you're right. We should add nuvoton specific stuff in meta-nuvoton and not meta-arm. Thanks a lot your sharing about how to fix this build error. After setting specific long path "recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a.inc" then we can add 2.6.0.bb and 2.6.0.bbappend in meta-nuvoton with build pass. Please help us to review it again. Thank you.

Something like one of these might help:

    require ${COREBASE}/meta-arm/meta-arm/...
    require ${COREBASE}/../meta-arm/meta-arm/...

(I don't know where COREBASE defaults to in our build.)

> Something like one of these might help:
>    require ${COREBASE}/meta-arm/meta-arm/...
>    require ${COREBASE}/../meta-arm/meta-arm/...t

"require recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a.inc" is sufficient as long as bblayers.conf of target machine layer has "##OEROOT##/meta-arm/meta-arm".

Might better to add following to meta-nuvoton/conf/layer.conf to make that dependency explicit.

```
LAYERDEPENDS_nuvoton-layer:append:npcm8xx = "meta-arm"
```

> > Something like one of these might help:
> >    require ${COREBASE}/meta-arm/meta-arm/...
> >    require ${COREBASE}/../meta-arm/meta-arm/...t
> 
> "require recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a.inc" is sufficient as long as bblayers.conf of target machine layer has "##OEROOT##/meta-arm/meta-arm".
> 
> Might better to add following to meta-nuvoton/conf/layer.conf to make that dependency explicit.
> 
> ```
> LAYERDEPENDS_nuvoton-layer:append:npcm8xx = "meta-arm"
> ```

👍
Thanks all you provide lots of suggestions to us. We've learned more the dependency between layers.

While orthogonal to recipe discussion, can you clean-up these Nuvoton patches with checkpatch.pl? See a lot of obvious style errors that could be fixed by script itself.

e.g.
```
total: 227 errors, 113 warnings, 110 checks, 2943 lines checked
NOTE: For some of the reported defects, checkpatch may be able to
      mechanically convert to the typical style using --fix or --fix-inplace.
0001-add-Arbel-NPCM8xx-platform-support.patch has style problems, please review.
```

It would be helpful for upstreaming to tf-a:

https://trustedfirmware-a.readthedocs.io/en/latest/process/coding-guidelines.html?highlight=checkpatch.pl#automatic-compliance-checking
Thanks your suggestion. We will use Nuvoton SRC_URI then we don't need to add this patch. However, we will consider to upstream tf-a and using checkpatch.pl to fix all errors. Thank you.
There is a lot of stuff in this file that seems like it should be coming from the .inc, right?
Yes, you're right. Most of stuff are come from arm-trusted-firmware.inc
Yes, not anymore. I've removed it. Thanks your review.
is the license different for your version?
No. it's the same. I had removed this duplicate definition. Thanks.
Yes. I had moved this line into npcm8xx.inc. Thank you.

Would also be nice to move the bb/bbappend files to meta-nuvoton/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a (no images/) to match convention followed by meta-arm and other consumers of meta-arm (e.g. meta-ti, meta-freescale, etc). This recipe is not really building image.
Thanks your review. I have moved those files into trusted-firmware-a folder.
Since you are setting version, the bbappend file could be renamed to trusted-firmware-a_%.bbappend.
Thanks your suggestion. I had renamed to trusted-firmware-a_%.bbappend.
These could be part of meta-nuvoton/conf/machine/include/npcm8xx.inc, no suffix ":npcm8xx" would be necessary then.
Thanks. I had moved related TFA definition into npcm8xx.inc.
If most of this is covered by the .inc file from meta-arm, are we going to remove it here?

Yes, as suggested before, should set following variables and meta-arm .inc would take care of almost everything.

# Nuvoton prefers optee for BL32.
TFA_SPD = opteed

# Nuvoton prefers u-boot as BL33.
TFA_UBOOT = 1

Note, some more stuff could move to npcm8xx.conf, as commented separately. Once Nuvoton rebases to upstream tf-a and optee, move all variables to nuvoton machine include files and drop the bbappend altogether.
Thanks all of you help to review this. I had removed those duplicate definition.

Dear Dhanajay,
There is build failure again about path not found from require recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a.inc.

We already add this line LAYERDEPENDS_nuvoton-layer:append:npcm8xx = "meta-arm" into meta-nuvoton/conf/layer.conf.
But I don't know why still meet this error.

Whether these targets gbs and gsj need to modify their bblayers.conf of target machine layer has "##OEROOT##/meta-arm/meta-arm"? Thanks.

target=gbs
14:06:57 ERROR: ParseError at /data0/jenkins/workspace/ci-openbmc/distro/ubuntu/label/docker-builder/target
/gbs/openbmc/meta-nuvoton/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bb:1: Could not include required file recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a.inc

target=gsj
14:06:54 ERROR: ParseError at /data0/jenkins/workspace/ci-openbmc/distro/ubuntu/label/docker-builder/target
/gsj/openbmc/meta-nuvoton/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bb:1: Could not include required file recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a.inc
14:07:13 ERROR: Parsing halted due to errors, see error messages above

There are 2 possible ways we could solve this: 

1. say everyone who uses meta-nuvoton also has to include meta-arm
2. use dynamic layers so this recipe is only parsed when meta-arm is present

I think 2. is probably cleaner since only people who need Arbel support really need meta-arm.

You can see an example of 2. here: https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/commit/a95e0907e4ced0ba950449b7ef1b04e2c75a5381

> We already add this line LAYERDEPENDS_nuvoton-layer:append:npcm8xx = "meta-arm" into meta-nuvoton/conf/layer.conf.

LAYERDEPENDS doesn't add layer itself, it just errors out if final BBLAYERS doesn't end-up with meta-arm.

> There are 2 possible ways we could solve this: 
> 
> 1. say everyone who uses meta-nuvoton also has to include meta-arm

Not all consumers, just those who include npcm8xx/Arbel, as LAYERDEPENDS_nuvoton-layer:append:npcm8xx.

If a layer uses npcm7xx/Poleg, it shouldn't have to include meta-arm.

> 2. use dynamic layers so this recipe is only parsed when meta-arm is present
> 
> I think 2. is probably cleaner since only people who need Arbel support really need meta-arm.
> 
> You can see an example of 2. here: https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/commit/a95e0907e4ced0ba950449b7ef1b04e2c75a5381

Even with the dynamic-layers, last layer has to include the dependency?
e.g.
```
meta-phosphor: dynamic-layers/{aspeed-layer,nuvoton-layer}/*
└── meta-google: dynamic-layers/{aspeed-layer,nuvoton-layer}/*
    └── meta-quanta/meta-gsj/conf/bblayers.conf.sample
          ##OEROOT##/meta-nuvoton \
          ##OEROOT##/meta-google \
```

> > We already add this line LAYERDEPENDS_nuvoton-layer:append:npcm8xx = "meta-arm" into meta-nuvoton/conf/layer.conf.
> 
> LAYERDEPENDS doesn't add layer itself, it just errors out if final BBLAYERS doesn't end-up with meta-arm.
> 
> > There are 2 possible ways we could solve this: 
> > 
> > 1. say everyone who uses meta-nuvoton also has to include meta-arm
> 
> Not all consumers, just those who include npcm8xx/Arbel, as LAYERDEPENDS_nuvoton-layer:append:npcm8xx.

Wouldn't the recipe still get parsed regardless (and error out with the missing `require`), unless it's in a dynamic layer?

> 
> If a layer uses npcm7xx/Poleg, it shouldn't have to include meta-arm.

> > > We already add this line LAYERDEPENDS_nuvoton-layer:append:npcm8xx = "meta-arm" into meta-nuvoton/conf/layer.conf.
> > 
> > LAYERDEPENDS doesn't add layer itself, it just errors out if final BBLAYERS doesn't end-up with meta-arm.
> > 
> > > There are 2 possible ways we could solve this: 
> > > 
> > > 1. say everyone who uses meta-nuvoton also has to include meta-arm
> > 
> > Not all consumers, just those who include npcm8xx/Arbel, as LAYERDEPENDS_nuvoton-layer:append:npcm8xx.
> 
> Wouldn't the recipe still get parsed regardless (and error out with the missing `require`), unless it's in a dynamic layer?

Not sure how Tim is testing but as POC I picked github-nuvoton/npcm-master, cherry-picked these PRs and tested that making following change works for evb-npcm845 machine. Note I had to also add meta-arm-toolchain as meta-arm declares itself dependent on it.

```
--- a/meta-evb/meta-evb-nuvoton/meta-evb-npcm845/conf/bblayers.conf.sample
+++ b/meta-evb/meta-evb-nuvoton/meta-evb-npcm845/conf/bblayers.conf.sample
@@ -11,6 +11,8 @@ BBLAYERS ?= " \
   ##OEROOT##/meta-openembedded/meta-networking \
   ##OEROOT##/meta-openembedded/meta-python \
   ##OEROOT##/meta-phosphor \
+  ##OEROOT##/meta-arm/meta-arm-toolchain \
+  ##OEROOT##/meta-arm/meta-arm \
   ##OEROOT##/meta-nuvoton \
   ##OEROOT##/meta-evb \
   ##OEROOT##/meta-evb/meta-evb-nuvoton \
```

Thanks all of you share such more experience for us.

Yes, Dhananjay. I did the same as yours. I modify meta-evb/../bblayers.conf.sample to add meta-arm and meta-arm-toolchain in my build environment. If I didn't modify this bblayers.conf.sample that will cause the trusted-firmware-a.inc file not found build error.

Seems we create this new folder trusted-firmware-a under meta-nuvoton/recipes-bsp, thus previous npcm7xx/Poleg project (target=gbs, gsj) will also build TFA recipe then cause this build error. Thus, I still try to make this TFA recipe should be build for npcm8xx/Arbel to avoid this kind of error, am I right?

Ok, now I understand the Poleg issue better. Technically what we're doing here isn't not normal Yocto workflow - creating a .bb of same recipe in downstream layer. When you rebase to upstream, you would either have just .bbappend or won't need it at all (just npcm8xx.inc will set all variables).

I wasn't sure about this 2.6.0.bb workflow initially, that's why was checking about you rebasing to 2.7.0 (option #1). There's additional context, as part of 2.6.0 -> 2.7.0 upgrade, some SSL/mbedtls stuff was also reworked, however it may not apply to you since you're not using ARM CoT (as per your explanation on #56005).

FWIW, there will be same issue for OPTEE, as you need 3.16 and meta-arm has 3.14 and 3.18 (they're not maintaining 2 versions for tf-a for some reason).

I would encourage rebase as this is just temporary hack (not sure about what issues you may be facing). If rebase is too hard, try moving trusted-firmware-a to meta-nuvoton/dynamic-layers/arm-layer/recipes-bsp as Benjamin pointed out.
Thank you Tim for addressing all comments, looks clean and easy to inherit via npcm8xx.inc.
Thanks your review. I had changed "nuvoton-layer" to "meta-arm".
Please help us to review and merge it. Meanwhile, I will modify OPTEE as TFA for you review it. Thanks so much.
This one seems like it belongs in the versioned bbfile, since it is related to the version.  You wouldn't want trusted-firmware-a-2.7.0.bb to get this SRCREV which is on 2.6.x.

> This one seems like it belongs in the versioned bbfile, since it is related to the version.  You wouldn't want trusted-firmware-a-2.7.0.bb to get this SRCREV which is on 2.6.x.

This bbappend is overriding SRC_URI to point to github-nuvoton/arm-trusted-firmware. Until Nuvoton's code is in upstream tf-a (git.trustedfirmware.org), the bbappend file will be here and SRCREV needs to point to specific commit.

Next logical step would be to rebase github-nuvoton/arm-trusted-firwmare to 2.7.0, update this bbappend and get rid of the 2.6.0.bb, which caused a bit of trouble.

Thanks both of you help to review and suggestion. Yes, we will try to rebase our github to 2.7.0 in next release. As you said that we don't need use 2.6.0.bb and just need to update this bbappend just for pointing to specific commit.

> This bbappend is overriding SRC_URI to point to github-nuvoton/arm-trusted-firmware. Until Nuvoton's code is in upstream tf-a (git.trustedfirmware.org), the bbappend file will be here and SRCREV needs to point to specific commit.

Getting nuvoton's fork repository updated to 2.7.0 (or anything after that) is secondary to my immediate concerns.  Eventually we need to completely do away with this recipe point to a Nuvoton repo, which means they need to get the code upstream.  If they do that in 2.7.x or 2.8.x, it doesn't matter so much.  In either case they're likely to have a 2.7.x-based bbappend file at some point in the future.  We cann't just "hope" that meta-arm doesn't delete a .bb file out from underneath us in the meantime.  (Net, we HAVE to keep a 2.6.x.bb file for now, and we will HAVE to keep a 2.7.x.bb file if Nuvoton does a rebase.)

My immediate issue is that we have an unversioned bbappend file (_%) which is fixing SRCREV.  This is entirely inappropriate.  If someone were to accidentally chose a meta-arm 2.7.0 file, this bbappend is now still forcing them to a 2.6.0-based SRCREV.  This is misleading and likely to cause someone a lot of headaches to debug.  I'd much rather have a hard failure (due to meta-arm SRCREV for 2.7.x not existing in Nuvoton-Israel) than a hidden issue like this.

Please ensure the SRCREV is put into the appropriate versioned bb or bbappend file.

> Getting nuvoton's fork repository updated to 2.7.0 (or anything after that) is secondary to my immediate concerns.  Eventually we need to completely do away with this recipe point to a Nuvoton repo, which means they need to get the code upstream.  If they do that in 2.7.x or 2.8.x, it doesn't matter so much.  In either case they're likely to have a 2.7.x-based bbappend file at some point in the future.  We cann't just "hope" that meta-arm doesn't delete a .bb file out from underneath us in the meantime.  (Net, we HAVE to keep a 2.6.x.bb file for now, and we will HAVE to keep a 2.7.x.bb file if Nuvoton does a rebase.)

If someone were to accidentally chose a meta-arm 2.7.0 file, this bbappend is now still forcing them to a 2.6.0-based SRCREV.  This is misleading and likely to cause someone a lot of headaches to debug.  I'd much rather have a hard failure (due to meta-arm SRCREV for 2.7.x not existing in Nuvoton-Israel) than a hidden issue like this.

I think it's not that complicated:

1. It should be SRCREV_tfa and not SRCREV wherever we put it, as meta-arm is using SRCREV_FORMAT:
`meta-arm/meta-arm/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a.inc:SRCREV_FORMAT = "tfa"`

2. 2.6.0.bb ported by Nuvoton already has `SRCREV_tfa = "a1f02f4f3daae7e21ee58b4c93ec3e46b8f28d15"`, but that's pointing to upstream tf-a repo. So does meta-arm 2.7.0.bb.

3. The bbappend file is changing both SRC_URI and SRCREV from Nuvoton's repo.

Cleaner approach would have been not to use Nuvoton's fork at all, but append patch files via bbappend here on top of meta-arm 2.7.0. But since we avoided this option, let the bbappend do the dirty work rather than making 2.6.0.bb point to Nuvoton's fork. If meta-arm whacks how recipe is built, putting SRCREV in .bb would not avoid fixing meta-nuvoton..
Agreed.  I don't know why SRCREV_tfa in this commit doesn't match SRCREV.  Nix the SRCREV here and make SRCREV_tfa (in this commit) correct and I'll be good.

> Agreed.  I don't know why SRCREV_tfa in this commit doesn't match SRCREV.  Nix the SRCREV here and make SRCREV_tfa (in this commit) correct and I'll be good.

They won't be same as they're commits from two different repositories. The 2.6.0.bb file is just an idler filling in SRCPV, has no other influence on what gets compiled. Looks like Nuvoton is not using same commit 2.6.0 release commit as basis.


```
$ git tag --contains 47ea2b50c8dd0b19217f70dc127299e23b0fe72c
npcm845x_2.6.0_1.5
npcm845x_2.6_1.5

$ git tag --contains a1f02f4f3daae7e21ee58b4c93ec3e46b8f28d15
npcm845x_2.6.0_1.5
npcm845x_2.6_1.5
v2.6
v2.6-rc1
v2.6_npcm845x_1.0
v2.6_npcm845x_1.1
v2.6_npcm845x_1.2
v2.6_npcm845x_1.3
v2.6_npcm845x_1.4
v2.6_npcm845x_1.5
v2.7
v2.7-rc0
v2.7-rc1
v2.7.0
```

ERROR: trusted-firmware-a-2.6.0-r0 do_fetch: Bitbake Fetcher Error: FetchError("Please set a valid SRCREV for url ['SRCREV_default:pn-trusted-firmware-a', 'SRCREV_default', 'SRCREV:pn-trusted-firmware-a', 'SRCREV'] (possible key names are git://github.com/Nuvoton-Israel/arm-trusted-firmware.git;branch=nuvoton;protocol=https, or use a ;rev=X URL parameter)", 'git://github.com/Nuvoton-Israel/arm-trusted-firmware.git;branch=nuvoton;protocol=https')

> after modify SRCREV to SRCREV_tfa in this trusted-firmware-a_%.bbappend then I meet fetch error as below. 

Something seems wrong with the include of `trusted-firmware-a.inc` then.  Can you check the `bitbake -ne` output to see the final value of SRCREV_FORMAT.  This should be "tfa" in order for it to look for "SRCREV_tfa".

Seems SRCREV_FORMAT is "tfa" and SRCREV_tfa="47ea2b50c8dd0b19217f70dc127299e23b0fe72c".

bitbake output snippet as below:
# $SRCREV_FORMAT [2 operations]
#   set /home/tim/npcm-master/openbmc/meta-arm/meta-arm/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a.inc:12
#     "tfa"
#   :append /home/tim/npcm-master/openbmc/meta-arm/meta-arm/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a.inc:57
#     "${@bb.utils.contains('TFA_MBEDTLS', '1', '_mbedtls', '', d)}"
# pre-expansion value:
#   "tfa${@bb.utils.contains('TFA_MBEDTLS', '1', '_mbedtls', '', d)}"
SRCREV_FORMAT="tfa"

# $SRCREV_tfa [2 operations]
#   set /home/tim/npcm-master/openbmc/meta-nuvoton/dynamic-layers/arm-layer/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a_2.6.0.bb:4
#     "a1f02f4f3daae7e21ee58b4c93ec3e46b8f28d15"
#   set /home/tim/npcm-master/openbmc/meta-nuvoton/dynamic-layers/arm-layer/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a_%.bbappend:3
#     "47ea2b50c8dd0b19217f70dc127299e23b0fe72c"
# pre-expansion value:
#   "47ea2b50c8dd0b19217f70dc127299e23b0fe72c"
SRCREV_tfa="47ea2b50c8dd0b19217f70dc127299e23b0fe72c"

@Tim You also need to have "name=tfa" in SRC_URI to match SRCREV_FORMAT
setup.
 
`SRC_URI:append = "git://github.com/Nuvoton-Israel/arm-trusted-firmware.git;branch=nuvoton;name=tfa;protocol=https"`
`SRCREV_tfa := "47ea2b50c8dd0b19217f70dc127299e23b0fe72c"`

See meta-arm/meta-arm/recipes-bsp/trusted-firmware-a/trusted-firmware-a.inc:
`SRC_URI = "git://git.trustedfirmware.org/TF-A/trusted-firmware-a.git;protocol=https;name=tfa;branch=master"`

@Dhananjay Thanks your help on it. Yes, we need to add "name=tfa" in our SRC_URI for match SRCREV_FORMAT as official TFA github.
